metadata.title: CVE-2021-41165 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
CKEditor4 is an open source WYSIWYG HTML editor. In affected version avulnerability has been discovered in the core HTML processing module andmay affect all plugins used by CKEditor 4. The vulnerability allowed toinject malformed comments HTML bypassing content sanitization, which couldresult in executing JavaScript code. It affects all users using theCKEditor 4 at version < 4.17.0. The problem has been recognized andpatched. The fix will be available in version 4.17.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.19.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.19.1+dfsg-1').
ckeditor3 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
ldap-account-manager package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
request-tracker4 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
